page_content:
Add Review Settings functionality

Version:MissionOS_2.0

Instrumentation > Data > View/Edit > Review Setup tab

Once you configure the Review Levels (Trigger values), they can be further customized via Review Settings.

For this, perform the following steps:

  1. Navigate to Instrument Data tab in the Homepage.
  2. Select the required instrument from the Instrument Selection
  3. Click View or Edit Instrument.
  4. You reach the View/Edit Instrument page.
  5. Click open the Review Setup
  6. Click Add Review Settings.
    A new set of Review settings fields populate below the main Review Setup fields.

The new fields include the following:

  • No of consecutive data.
  • You can Select scenario from options such as Breach only for continuous increase/decrease and Breach for any data.

 

 

How the review settings work:

If you set No of Consecutive Data = 3

 

Select scenario as Breach for any data.

  1. For less than 3 consecutive breach readings, no notification is sent.
  2. For 3 or more breach readings, notification gets triggered if you select the scenario as Breach for any data.
  3. If you set No of Consecutive Data = 3, and select the scenario Breach only for Continuous increase/decrease, a notification will only be sent if the three consecutive readings are continuously rising/falling. This can be beneficial in the case of fluctuating readings at a specific trigger level.

 

 

 

Refer to Figures 3, 4, 5 and 6 below for understanding the concept with combination of review factor settings:

Scenario 1 – When Reset is ON, Consecutive N = 3, and Breach for Any

 

 

Scenario 2 – When Reset is OFF, Consecutive N = 3, and Breach for Any

Note:

If the first breach reading is at Alarm level, the highest breach gets notified. But if Reset is OFF, there will not be any further notification for subsequent lower-level breaches.

 

 

Scenario 3 – When Reset is ON, Consecutive N = 3, and Breach only for Continuous increase/decrease

As per the figure below, at Alert Level, the pattern breaks for continuous increase.

 

 

 

Scenario 4 – When Reset is OFF, Consecutive N = 3, and Breach only for Continuous increase/decrease

In this case, only one notification is sent due to the data not showing a continuous increase/decrease.

 

 

For more information on how to View or Edit Review Setup of an instrument, refer to the manual View or Edit Review Setup
